easyclimate 0.1.0
  • Get started
  • Reference

easyclimate: easy access to high-resolution daily climate data for Europe

Source: vignettes/easyclimate.Rmd
easyclimate.Rmd
library(easyclimate)

Examples

# Coords as matrix
coords <- matrix(c(-5.36, 37.40), ncol = 2)

ex <- get_daily_climate(coords, period = "2001-01-01")  # single day
ex
#>   ID_coords     x    y       date Prcp
#> 1         1 -5.36 37.4 2001-01-01  945

ex <- get_daily_climate(coords, period = c("2001-01-01", "2001-01-03"))  # 1st AND 3rd Jan 2001
ex
#>   ID_coords     x    y       date Prcp
#> 1         1 -5.36 37.4 2001-01-01  945
#> 2         1 -5.36 37.4 2001-01-03  205

ex <- get_daily_climate(coords, period = "2001-01-01:2001-01-03")  # 1st TO 3rd Jan 2001
ex
#>   ID_coords     x    y       date Prcp
#> 1         1 -5.36 37.4 2001-01-01  945
#> 2         1 -5.36 37.4 2001-01-02   12
#> 3         1 -5.36 37.4 2001-01-03  205

ex <- get_daily_climate(coords, period = 2008)  # entire year
head(ex)
#>   ID_coords     x    y       date Prcp
#> 1         1 -5.36 37.4 2008-01-01  364
#> 2         1 -5.36 37.4 2008-01-02 2456
#> 3         1 -5.36 37.4 2008-01-03  573
#> 4         1 -5.36 37.4 2008-01-04    0
#> 5         1 -5.36 37.4 2008-01-05    0
#> 6         1 -5.36 37.4 2008-01-06    0
tail(ex)
#>     ID_coords     x    y       date Prcp
#> 361         1 -5.36 37.4 2008-12-26    0
#> 362         1 -5.36 37.4 2008-12-27  396
#> 363         1 -5.36 37.4 2008-12-28  672
#> 364         1 -5.36 37.4 2008-12-29  155
#> 365         1 -5.36 37.4 2008-12-30    0
#> 366         1 -5.36 37.4 2008-12-31  304

ex <- get_daily_climate(coords, period = c(2008, 2010))  # 2008 AND 2010
head(ex)
#>   ID_coords     x    y       date Prcp
#> 1         1 -5.36 37.4 2008-01-01  364
#> 2         1 -5.36 37.4 2008-01-02 2456
#> 3         1 -5.36 37.4 2008-01-03  573
#> 4         1 -5.36 37.4 2008-01-04    0
#> 5         1 -5.36 37.4 2008-01-05    0
#> 6         1 -5.36 37.4 2008-01-06    0
tail(ex)
#>     ID_coords     x    y       date Prcp
#> 726         1 -5.36 37.4 2010-12-26    0
#> 727         1 -5.36 37.4 2010-12-27    0
#> 728         1 -5.36 37.4 2010-12-28    0
#> 729         1 -5.36 37.4 2010-12-29  271
#> 730         1 -5.36 37.4 2010-12-30 2073
#> 731         1 -5.36 37.4 2010-12-31  936

ex <- get_daily_climate(coords, period = 2008:2010)  # 2008 TO 2010
head(ex)
#>   ID_coords     x    y       date Prcp
#> 1         1 -5.36 37.4 2008-01-01  364
#> 2         1 -5.36 37.4 2008-01-02 2456
#> 3         1 -5.36 37.4 2008-01-03  573
#> 4         1 -5.36 37.4 2008-01-04    0
#> 5         1 -5.36 37.4 2008-01-05    0
#> 6         1 -5.36 37.4 2008-01-06    0
tail(ex)
#>      ID_coords     x    y       date Prcp
#> 1091         1 -5.36 37.4 2010-12-26    0
#> 1092         1 -5.36 37.4 2010-12-27    0
#> 1093         1 -5.36 37.4 2010-12-28    0
#> 1094         1 -5.36 37.4 2010-12-29  271
#> 1095         1 -5.36 37.4 2010-12-30 2073
#> 1096         1 -5.36 37.4 2010-12-31  936

## Differnet climatic_var
ex <- get_daily_climate(coords, period = "2001-01-01", climatic_var = "Tmin")


# Coords as data.frame
coords <- as.data.frame(coords)
names(coords) <- c("lon", "lat")  # must have these columns
ex <- get_daily_climate(coords, period = "2001-01-01")  # single day
ex
#>   ID_coords   lon  lat     x    y       date Prcp
#> 1         1 -5.36 37.4 -5.36 37.4 2001-01-01  945

# Coords as sf
coords <- sf::st_as_sf(coords, coords = c("lon", "lat"))
ex <- get_daily_climate(coords, period = "2001-01-01")  # single day
ex
#>   ID_coords     x    y       date Prcp
#> 1         1 -5.36 37.4 2001-01-01  945

# Several points
coords <- matrix(c(-5.36, 37.40, -4.05, 38.10), ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE)
ex <- get_daily_climate(coords, period = "2001-01-01")
ex
#>   ID_coords     x    y       date Prcp
#> 1         1 -5.36 37.4 2001-01-01  945
#> 2         2 -4.05 38.1 2001-01-01  716

ex <- get_daily_climate(coords, period = "2001-01-01", output = "raster")  # raster output
ex
#> class       : SpatRaster 
#> dimensions  : 84, 157, 1  (nrow, ncol, nlyr)
#> resolution  : 0.008333333, 0.008333333  (x, y)
#> extent      : -5.358333, -4.05, 37.4, 38.1  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)
#> coord. ref. : +proj=longlat +datum=WGS84 +no_defs 
#> source      : memory 
#> name        : 2001-01-01 
#> min value   :        617 
#> max value   :       1322
library(terra)
#> terra version 1.2.13
plot(ex)



## Polygons
coords <- terra::vect("POLYGON ((-5 38, -5 37.5, -4.5 37.5, -4.5 38, -5 38))")

# Return raster
ex <- get_daily_climate(coords, period = "2001-01-01", output = "raster")
ex
#> class       : SpatRaster 
#> dimensions  : 60, 60, 1  (nrow, ncol, nlyr)
#> resolution  : 0.008333333, 0.008333333  (x, y)
#> extent      : -5, -4.5, 37.5, 38  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)
#> coord. ref. : +proj=longlat +datum=WGS84 +no_defs 
#> source      : memory 
#> name        : 2001-01-01 
#> min value   :        969 
#> max value   :       1322
plot(ex)


# Calculate average across polygon
ex <- get_daily_climate(coords, period = "2001-01-01", fun = "mean")
ex
#>   ID_coords       date     Prcp
#> 1         1 2001-01-01 1144.555
# Calculate min across polygon
ex <- get_daily_climate(coords, period = "2008-09-27", fun = "min")
ex
#>   ID_coords       date Prcp
#> 1         1 2008-09-27  757

Calculating monthly, yearly and other indices

Examples: evolution of tmean in January for a site, multilayer rasters, etc
